item.title: Ticket #214 (When publishing a new post it create 2 paragraph tags) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When writing a new entry and publishing the generated XHTML creates 2 opening and closing P tags in the 'the_content()'

item.title: Ticket #213 (Smilies should be a plug-in) created
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description:
I like to modify the WP code to add my own smilies, however every time I upgrade, my changes are overridden.

Personally, I think the smiley functionality should be a plugin, and not a built-in feature, making it more adaptable to change.

item.title: Changeset [1512]: In sanitize_title(), strip_tags() before sanitizing, not after. In ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: In sanitize_title(), strip_tags() before sanitizing, not after. In post.php, if post name is empty, pass the post title to the sanitizer.

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Stanley
item.description:
Updated from CVS for both PHP5.0.x and WP1.3.x as of today (4th Aug) and the seg-fault issues appears to have gone for now...

Would be nice if others can confirm what I'm seeing?

item.title: Ticket #197 (Problem posting from a desktop client) updated
item.dc:creator: dangore
item.description: No, that can't be the problem because my apache server with wordpress is hosted on my desktop. So the times are the same.

item.title: Ticket #197 (Problem posting from a desktop client) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: its problably because you can't post in the future, meaning that your computer's time is a few hours ahead of your servers time, and since the post time is retrieved from your computer you are trying to post in the future.

item.title: Changeset [1510]: stripslashes() from $pwd before performing the md5. Otherwise, we ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: stripslashes() from $pwd before performing the md5. Otherwise, we will not match the database password which had its slashes stripped before the MD5.

item.title: Ticket #212 (Permalink Options: Instructions to 'select all' is Windows-specific) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Technically, it's not Windows specific. Many other desktop enviroments use CTL + A for that purpose. That said, we can probably mention both bindings.

item.title: Ticket #212 (Permalink Options: Instructions to 'select all' is Windows-specific) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: "Click in the field and press CTRL + a to select all." is Windows-specific, and is not correct for all operating systems. For example, in OS X the key is CMD + a.
